title: Activity-Based Instructional Design for Manipulative Utilization in Mathematical Concept Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and elementary education experience
context.additional_context: A course for pre-/in-service teachers to strengthen mathematics pedagogy linked to social studies curricula

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more lesson designs based on manipulative-based learning (LTA) grounded in activity-based learning theory.
Learners can develop mathematics concept teaching plans using virtual/physical manipulatives in a PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach.
Learners can implement strategies to connect manipulative activities with abstract mathematical concepts by applying the "mental run task" technique.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
